summary: CFG captures the main while loop structure with entry, loop body, and exit. The loop back-edge from the increment operation to the condition check is missing, and overflow checking path is present but missing the successful continuation after addition.
missing_paths: Loop back-edge: After incrementing i (i = i + 1), control should return to the loop condition check (i < loops) at block 7
Successful overflow check continuation: Block 8 should have an edge to a block that stores the result and continues the loop, but this path is not shown
observations: Block 0-2: Contract deployment with CALLVALUE check (revert if ETH sent) - correct
Block 3: Function selector dispatch for 0x0b7d796e (loop) and 0x8381f58a (number getter) - correct
Block 4-5: Parameter decoding for loop function with input validation - correct
Block 7: Loop condition check (i < loops) with branch to block 8 (loop body) or block 10 (exit) - correct structure
Block 8: Loop body performs number + 1 with SafeMath overflow check, calls helper at 0x0166
Block 9: Overflow revert path with Panic(0x11) - arithmetic overflow error - correct
Block 10: Loop exit leading to STOP - correct
Block 8 shows the addition operation but CFG is missing the back-edge to block 7 for loop continuation
The increment of i (i = i + 1) appears to be inlined in the bytecode but the graph does not show the complete cycle back to condition
Block 13: Getter function for 'number' state variable - correct implementation
Block 14: Fallback revert for invalid function selectors - correct
